meaningMnemonic:
The kanji means <kanji>infancy</kanji>. The adjective version describes someone who is <vocabulary>very young</vocabulary>, like little kids in their early childhood or babyhood!

Depending on the context, it can also describe behaviors or ideas that are <vocabulary>childish</vocabulary> or immature, often with a negative connotation.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

When you were <vocabulary>very young</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>childish</vocabulary> you were sent off to do prayers to ask for forgiveness. One of the things you had to do was sing "<reading>hosanna</reading> (おさな) in the highest."
